meanings.definition: The light-sensitive layer of tissue at the back of the eye.
meanings.sent1: The retinae capture light in the eye.
meanings.sent2: Doctors examine the retinae during an eye check-up.
meanings.sent3: The retinae decided to take a break from light today.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams painted vivid pictures on the retinae of her mind.
meanings.sent5: The retinae are like the camera film of the eye, capturing images for the brain.

meanings.sent1: I have two retinae in my eyes.
meanings.sent2: The doctor studied the patient's retinae closely.
meanings.sent3: The retinae gathered for a group photo.
meanings.sent4: The retinae of the team worked together to see the bigger picture.
meanings.sent5: The retinae in the lab specimens were carefully examined under the microscope.
